vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐπικᾰλύπτ-ω,
cover over, cover up, shroud, κακὸν δ᾽ ἐπὶ κῶμα καλύπτει variant in [Refs]; of snow covering a track, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:— passive, to be covered over, veiled, ἡ ἐπωνυμία ἐπικεκάλυπται 5th-6th c.BC: Plato Philosophus “Cratylus” 395b; ἐπικαλύπτεσθαι τὸν νοῦν πάθει ἢ ὕπνῳ is darkened, obscured, [Refs]
__II. put as a covering over, βλεφάρων φᾶρος [Refs 5th c.BC+] —passive, τῶν βλεφάρων -κεκαλυμμένων when the eyelids are drawn down, [Refs]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
(passive) to be covered cover
to cover over;, metaphorically to cover or veil by a pardon, Rom. 4:7*
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: khỏa lấp; phủ lấp. ἐπί (G1909) + καλύπτω (G2572)
